Papehroch contended that the author of the Liie was Theodorie, a monk of Durham, but it is now generally ascribed to Turgot,¹ who entered into orders in 1074, became Prior oi Durham in 1087, and was consecrated Arehbishop oi St Andrews August 1, 1109, by Thomas Second Archbishop oi York, with reservation ol the rights of his See in respect to the question ol the primacy os York over Scotland· He was for sometime the consessor os St Margaret, and died in the monastery at Durham in 1115, whither he had obtained per· mission from the king, to retire, owing to a disagreement with him, probably, as Mr. Robertson suggests, in reference to the necessity ol immediately remedelling the state of the Scottish Church³
